poem:
Title: A Woman's Constitution

Her cheeks, canvas for another's vision,
Held in the curve of industry's precision.
O to dwell not in powders and gloss,
But in the spirit of her own glossary.
Disapprove does the consort, yet she stands,
Unmoved like her homeland's granite hands.
The storm, it rages, but she adorns,
Her own self, dawn to dawn.
